summary.para: Outputs the indices of the minimum-valued elements within one or more dimensions of the input tensor.

Each output element is the result of applying an argmin reduction on a subset of the input tensor. The argmin function outputs the index of the minimum-valued element within a set of input elements. The input elements involved in each reduction are determined by the provided input axes. Similarly, each output index is with respect to the provided input axes. If all input axes are specified, then the operator applies a single argmin reduction, and produces a single output element.

remarks.para: The output tensor sizes must be the same as the input tensor sizes, except for the reduced axes, which must be 1.
When AxisDirection is , this API is equivalent to with .
A subset of this functionality is exposed through the operator, and is supported on earlier DirectML feature levels.

summary.para: The tensor to write the results to. Each output element is the result of an argmin reduction on a subset of elements from the InputTensor.

item.description: DimensionCount must match InputTensor.DimensionCount (the rank of the input tensor is preserved).
Sizes must match InputTensor.Sizes, except for dimensions included in the reduced Axes, which must be size 1.

summary.para: The number of axes to reduce. This field determines the size of the Axes array.
The axes along which to reduce. Values must be in the range [0, InputTensor.DimensionCount - 1].
Determines which index to select when multiple input elements have the same value.

item.description: DML_AXIS_DIRECTION_INCREASING returns the index of the first minimum-valued element (for example, argmin({1,2,3,2,1}) = 0)
DML_AXIS_DIRECTION_DECREASING returns the index of the last minimum-valued element (for example, argmin({1,2,3,2,1}) = 4)
